title: Hocus Pocus 2 'in the works' at Disney+ and the original cast could return
text:

It's been rumoured for a long time now that a sequel to the Halloween classic, Hocus Pocus could be made.

And now it seems we finally have an answer.

According to Collider.com a follow-up to the 1993 movie starring Bette Midler, Sarah Jessica Parker and Kathy Najimy, is currently in the works at Disney.

They report that the new movie will be made for the film giant's upcoming streaming platform Disney+ which launches in the US on November 12, but has no UK release date as of yet.

(Image: Disney)

Jen D'Angelo, who has written and produced shows such as Workaholics and Cougar Town, is said to have been hired to write the script for the sequel.

None of the original cast members are attached to the project as it stands, but sources say that D'Angelo has been tasked with finding a way to incorporate them into the movie.

It is currently unclear as to whether the new film will feature the three as the main characters or whether the Sanderson sisters will have passed on the torch to a different generation of witches.

(Image: Disney)

Hocus Pocus initially failed to impress audiences at the box office but has gone on to become a cult classic over the years.

Directed by Kenny Ortega, who also made the High School Musical movies, the film followed Max Dennison (Omri Katz) a teenage boy who moves to Salem and accidentally resurrects Winnifred, Sarah and Mary Sanderson on Halloween after lighting the black flame candle.

The three witches, who had been dead for 300 years, plan to steal the youth from children in order to stay young and beautiful forever - but struggle slightly in the modern world.

Along with his little sister Dani (Thora Birch), his school crush Allison (Vinessa Shaw) and a talking cat called Binx (Sean Murray), Max must stop the witches before it's too late.

This isn't the first time Disney has attempted to develop a Hocus Pocus sequel.

Back in September 2017, it was reported that a "new iteration" of the beloved movie was in the works at Disney Channel without the original stars.

At the time Ortega told ETOnline that he was keen to see a sequel - but only if it featured the film's three leading ladies.

He said: "I would like to see a sequel, and I think fans would like to see a sequel. I think it would be much more fun to bring the ladies back.

"They're all still vital and in their prime and capable of doing so much that it would be great to see Bette and Kathy and Sarah come back together to do another movie and I think they would like to."
description: According to multiple reports Disney is developing a sequel to the 1993 classic for their new streaming platform Disney+
